item.title: Fighting Burnout, Burnout Series Pt. 2
item.description: The second part of in my series on burnout: Fighting Burnout.

item.title: What Actually is Burnout, Burnout Series Pt. 1
item.description: I’ve begun a series on burnout and what we can do about. The first part of the series can be found here.

item.title: Depression and Flow
item.description: On June 16, I was fortunate enough to give my first conference workshop, entitled “Going with the Flow: Increasing Mindfulness and Flow Experiences to Fight Burnout and Depression” at Wordcamp Europe. I gave the workshop in partnership with Open Sourcing Mental Illness, a non-profit working to raise awareness of mental health issues in the tech industry. I created a repo with summarized information and resources, and I’ll be sure to post a video when it becomes available.

item.title: My Mandatory Junior Web Dev Post
item.description: My post about starting out in the world as a junior dev is on Medium here

item.title: Danish Harm Reduction
item.description: I wrote an article highlighting the effectiveness of harm reduction for the substance use and mental health blog The Fix, and it can be found here.

About Hi. My name is Nathan, and I live in Copenhagen. I am clinical social worker turned developer, and I currently work at Too Good To Go as a DevOps engineer. I use this site to collect some of my thoughts about a number of topics in the blog. I’m also happy to accept any kind of request or introduction via email.
